snippet: The highest paid chief executive in 2010, earning more than $3 million, was Bob Kerrey of the New School in New York City, according to an analysis of federal tax documents by The Chronicle of Higher Education.
abstract: Chronicle of Higher Education analysis finds that in 2010, 36 private-college presidents earned more than $1 million in total compensation, which is same number as in 2009; Bob Kerrey, president of the New School in New York City, was highest paid with total compensation of $3,047,703.
lead_paragraph: The highest paid chief executive in 2010, earning more than $3 million, was Bob Kerrey of the New School in New York City, according to an analysis of federal tax documents by The Chronicle of Higher Education.

headline.seo: Three Dozen Private-College Presidents Earned Over $1 Million in 2010
headline.main: Three Dozen Private-College Presidents Earned Over $1 Million in 2010, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Heads of Three Dozen Private Colleges Earn Over $1 Million
